Alternative is a construction with a different verb and the NOM_DATtak pattern: “P'ayt-ə iĵav ĵri tak” [дерево[NOM]-DEF опускаться:AOR:3SG вода:DAT под].

Alternative that is associated with the standard language is the same verb with the NOM_DAT pattern: “Petros-ə siraharvec' Mariam-i-n” [Петрос[NOM]-DEF влюбляться:AOR:3SG Мариам-DAT-DEF]. The two constructions are interchangeable.

Alternative is the construction where the X argument is encoded as the nominative subject but in this construction, it is not easy to overtly express the stimulus, cf. ? “Petros-ə zarmac'av nver-ic'” [Петрос[NOM]-DEF удивляться:AOR:3SG подарок-ABL] and ?? “Petros-ə zarmac'av nver-i vra” [Петрос[NOM]-DEF удивляться:AOR:3SG подарок-DAT на].

In fact, the consultant tends to prefer a different option, where the Y argument is encoded by DATpatcarov: “Petros-n amač'um1 ē2 ir hasak-i patčaŕ-ov” [Петрос[NOM]-DEF стесняться:PRS:3SG1,2 свой рост-DAT причина-INS]. The consultant’s explanation is that the NOM_ABL option can be confusing as potentially implying the weird reading is where “the height” is understood as a counteragent whose presence makes X feel shy. However, there are multiple examples in the corpus confirming that the ablative noun phrase is used in exactly the same meaning as the one implied in the questionnaire.
